p.s: ImI'm an exchange student from Germany and today I will be talking about fast fashion.
If you look at the label of your t-shirt you will most likely find a tag, that says made in Bangladesh, but what is the textile industry and the atmosphere there like?
Bangladesh as a whole is in a terrible condition.
Rivers are polutedpolluted and poisoned, because textile factories throw their garbage in the rivers which leads to the water being black and dirty and people are living in junk.
The employees work ten to twelve hours a day and only get a 10 minutes break every two hours.
Most of the workers are proud of what they're doing, most likely because they don't even know how bad their working conditins really are.
Now you might ask yourself, how you can help the workers and how to buy more sustainable fashion.
The expert Imke MÃ¼ller-Hellmann states not buying from Bangladesh isn't the right soluditionsolution.
This would take the workersworkers' only source of income, instead the big companyscompanies which are treating their workers poorly, should be exposed and held accountable.
Also the politicians should focus more on the working conditions and check them regularly.
I hope you all are now more aware how much fast fashion affects the workers.
